page.title:
What is TACT?
What is TACT?
page.normal_text:
The Ticketing Aggressive Cars and Trucks (TACT) Program is a Selective Traffic Enforcement (STEP) Program. The goal of TACT is to deter unsafe driving behaviors by passenger vehicle (PV) and commercial motor vehicle (CMV) drivers when they interact to share the road.
The Ticketing Aggressive Cars and Trucks T h e

page.title:
The Mission of TACT
The Mission of TACT
page.normal_text:
The mission of the TACT program is to reduce CMV-related
The mission of the TACT program is to reduce CMV-related

crashes, injuries, and fatalities by combining outreach,
crashes, injuries, and fatalities by combining outreach,

education, and evaluation with targeted enforcement activities
education, and evaluation with targeted enforcement activities

to raise awareness among car and truck drivers about safe
to raise awareness among car and truck drivers about safe

driving behaviors.
driving behaviors.

page.title:
Funding Your TACT Program
Funding Your TACT Program
page.normal_text:
The Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act: A Legacy for Users (SAFETEA-LU) requires that States conduct comprehensive and highly-visible traffic enforcement and commercial motor vehicle safety inspection programs in high-risk locations and corridors.
The Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation T h e

A c c o u n t a b l e ,
F l e x i b l e ,
E f f i c i e n t
T r a n s p o r t a t i o n

U s e r s
( S A F E T E A - L U ) r e q u i r e s
that States conduct comprehensive and highly-visible traffic
enforcement and commercial motor vehicle safety inspection
programs in high-risk locations and corridors.

States can apply for grants from two funding sources:
States can apply for grants from two funding sources:
page.enlisting:
—Basic, Incentive Grants and High Priority Grants
—Basic, Incentive Grants and High Priority Grants
